Class SocketClientHandler

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.is25am22new.Network.Socket.Server.SocketClientHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
VirtualView, Remote
public class SocketClientHandler extends Object implements VirtualView

  • Constructor Details

    • SocketClientHandler

      public SocketClientHandler(GameController controller, SocketServerSide server, InputStream is, OutputStream os) throws IOException
      Constructs a new SocketClientHandler to manage communication between the server and a single client. This class initializes the input and output streams for communication, sets up a heartbeat manager to detect connection loss, and prepares a map of supported commands.
      Parameters:
      controller - the game controller responsible for managing the game logic.
      server - the server instance to which this client handler belongs.
      is - the input stream used to receive data from the client.
      os - the output stream used to send data to the client.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs during input or output stream initialization.

  • Method Details

    • runVirtualView

      public void runVirtualView(Thread thread)
      Handles communication from the client to the server by processing incoming messages through a socket connection. The method listens for serialized SocketMessage objects, identifies the associated command, and executes the corresponding action.
      Parameters:
      thread - the thread on which this method is executed, used to manage the context of communication and interaction with the client.

    • showUpdateTest

      public void showUpdateTest()
      Sends an update test message to the connected socket client. This method constructs a new `InputCommand` object and sets its index to 9033. A `SocketMessage` instance is then created with the type "updateTest", the `InputCommand` object as the payload, and the message "Update message received". The method writes this `SocketMessage` to the output stream using the `objectOutput` field, ensuring the data is flushed immediately. If an `IOException` occurs during the writing process, the method outputs the error message to the console. Notes: - The `objectOutput` field must be properly initialized before invoking this method. - The `InputCommand` class is used to encapsulate the command payload sent within the `SocketMessage`. - Intended for testing purposes to verify communication functionality with the client.

    • heartbeat

      public void heartbeat(String nickname)
      Receives and processes a heartbeat signal from a client. This method is invoked whenever a client sends a heartbeat to inform the server that the connection is still alive and active.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The unique nickname of the client sending the heartbeat.

    • showUpdateBank

      public void showUpdateBank(Bank bank)
      Sends an updated Bank object to the client via a socket connection. This method serializes the provided Bank object and writes it to the output stream. If an IOException occurs during the write operation, an error message is logged.
      Specified by:
      showUpdateBank in interface VirtualView
      Parameters:
      bank - the Bank object containing the updated state to be sent to the client

    • showUpdateTileInHand

      public void showUpdateTileInHand(String player, ComponentTile tile)
      Sends an update message to the connected client regarding a tile that the specified player currently holds in their hand.
      Specified by:
      showUpdateTileInHand in interface VirtualView
      Parameters:
      player - the name of the player who holds the tile
      tile - the tile object to be updated for the player

      Parameters:

    • showUpdateStopHourglass

      public void showUpdateStopHourglass()
      Sends a `StopHourglass` command to the client via the socket connection. This method is used to notify the client to stop the hourglass timer. The message is constructed using a `SocketMessage` object with the command "StopHourglass" and is sent through the ObjectOutputStream. If an IOException occurs during the message sending process, the error is caught and an error message is logged to the console.
      Specified by:
      showUpdateStopHourglass in interface VirtualView

    • showUpdateStartHourglass

      public void showUpdateStartHourglass(int hourglassSpot)
      Sends a message to indicate the start of the hourglass at a specific spot to the connected client through the socket output stream.
      Specified by:
      showUpdateStartHourglass in interface VirtualView
      Parameters:
      hourglassSpot - the position or identifier of the hourglass to be started on the client side.

    • showLobbyUpdate

      public void showLobbyUpdate(List<String> players, Map<String,Boolean> readyStatus, String gameType)
      Sends a lobby update to the client, including the list of players, their ready statuses, and the selected game type. This method uses SocketMessage objects to encapsulate the relevant data and transmits it via an ObjectOutputStream.
      Specified by:
      showLobbyUpdate in interface VirtualView
      Parameters:
      players - a list of player nicknames currently in the lobby
      readyStatus - a map where each key is a player's nickname and each value is a boolean indicating whether the player is ready
      gameType - the type of game selected, represented as a string

    • showConnectionResult

      public void showConnectionResult(boolean isHost, boolean success, String message)
      Sends the result of a connection operation to the client. This method sends two messages to the client via the objectOutput stream. The first message contains information on whether the client is a host and an associated message. The second message indicates the success or failure of the connection operation.
      Specified by:
      showConnectionResult in interface VirtualView
      Parameters:
      isHost - a boolean indicating whether the client is acting as the host
      success - a boolean indicating whether the connection attempt was successful
      message - a string containing additional information or context about the connection result

    • showNicknameResult

      public void showNicknameResult(boolean valid, String payload)
      Sends the result of a nickname validation to the client. This method constructs a SocketMessage containing the validation result and attempts to send it over the established object output stream.
      Specified by:
      showNicknameResult in interface VirtualView
      Parameters:
      valid - indicates whether the nickname validation was successful or not
      payload - a string containing additional information about the validation result

    • showGameStarted

      public void showGameStarted()
      Sends a "GameStarted" message to the connected client through a socket output stream. This method is responsible for notifying the client that the game has started by creating a new instance of SocketMessage with the "GameStarted" command. It then writes this message object to the socket output stream and flushes it, ensuring the message is sent promptly. If an IOException occurs during the operation, it logs an error message to the console detailing the issue.
      Specified by:
      showGameStarted in interface VirtualView

    • showPlayerJoined

      public void showPlayerJoined(String player)
      Sends a notification to the client indicating that a new player has joined the game.
      Specified by:
      showPlayerJoined in interface VirtualView
      Parameters:
      player - the name of the player who has joined the game

    • showUpdateLeaderboard

      public void showUpdateLeaderboard(Map<String,Integer> leaderboard) throws RemoteException
      Sends a message to update the leaderboard on the client's side. The leaderboard data is encapsulated in a SocketMessage object and transmitted through the associated output stream.
      Specified by:
      showUpdateLeaderboard in interface VirtualView
      Parameters:
      leaderboard - a map containing the leaderboard data, where the keys are player names and the values are their respective scores.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote communication error occurs during the operation.

    • terminate

      public void terminate()
      Terminates the interaction with the socket client by sending a wait result message. This method overrides the terminate behavior and triggers the communication of the termination state to the client.
      Specified by:
      terminate in interface VirtualView

    • showUpdateGameLoaded

      public void showUpdateGameLoaded(Game game)
      Specified by:
      showUpdateGameLoaded in interface VirtualView

    • startGameByHost

      public void startGameByHost(String playerName)
      Starts the game in the lobby, ensuring only the host can initiate the process and all players are marked as ready before proceeding.
      Parameters:
      playerName - the name of the player attempting to start the game (must match the lobby creator's name to succeed)

    • setGameType

      public void setGameType(String gameType)
      Sets the game type for the current session and updates relevant states. This method sets the specified game type in the GameController, updates all lobbies to reflect the new game type, and marks the game as started.
      Parameters:
      gameType - the type of game to be set (e.g. "Adventure", "Strategy"). It must be a non-null string representing the desired game format.

    • pickCoveredTile

      public void pickCoveredTile(String playerName)
      Allows a player to pick a covered tile during the game. The request is forwarded to the game controller for processing, and it is synchronized to ensure thread safety.
      Parameters:
      playerName - the name of the player attempting to pick a covered tile

    • pickUncoveredTile

      public void pickUncoveredTile(String playerName, String pngName)
      Requests the server to allow the specified player to pick an uncovered tile identified by its image name. The action is forwarded to the game controller.
      Parameters:
      playerName - the name of the player attempting to pick the uncovered tile
      pngName - the name of the PNG image representing the tile to be picked

    • weldComponentTile

      public void weldComponentTile(String playerName, int i, int j, int numOfRotation)
      Rotates a component tile and welds it to the specified position on the game board. The tile can be rotated a specified number of times in a clockwise or counterclockwise direction before being welded.
      Parameters:
      playerName - the name of the player performing the action
      i - the row index of the target position on the game board
      j - the column index of the target position on the game board
      numOfRotation - the number of rotations to apply to the component tile; positive values indicate clockwise rotation, and negative values indicate counterclockwise rotation

    • getObjectInput

      public ObjectInputStream getObjectInput()
      Returns the ObjectInputStream used for receiving serialized objects from the associated socket connection.
      Returns:
      the ObjectInputStream associated with the socket connection

    • getObjectOutput

      public ObjectOutputStream getObjectOutput()
      Retrieves the ObjectOutputStream associated with this instance.
      Returns:
      The ObjectOutputStream used for sending data.

    • getHeartbeatManager

      public HeartbeatManager getHeartbeatManager()
      Retrieves the HeartbeatManager associated with this instance.
      Returns:
      the current instance of HeartbeatManager used for managing heartbeat signals.
